alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Northern Spartanburg; Southern Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:44AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Spartanburg and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 244 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Spartanburg, or near Boiling Springs SC, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Boiling Springs SC, Cowpens, Mayo, Chesnee, Cowpens National Battlefield, USC Upstate, Draytonville and Thicketty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
